title.narrative: Supporting priority Renewable Energy investment projects in Guyana

description.narrative: The purpose of the project is to provide demand-led task-specific support to the government of Guyana to secure funding for four (4) renewable energy projects: 1.Annai community electrification: Power Up to 225kWp + 475kWh: CAPEX Up to US $ 1M 2.Rural electrification programme: Power Up to 2 MWp: CAPEX Up to $15M 3.Guyana Hinterland Electrification Programme: Power Up to 2.1 Mp: CAPEX: Up t US$ 8.6M 4.Hope Beach Wind Farm: Power Up to 25.2 MW: CAPEX: Up to US $ 47M

The purpose of the project is to provide demand-led task-specific support to the government of Guyana to secure funding renewable energy projects. In 2020 the expected support is in 5 projects. In 2021, the project has been extended. the outputs has been modified to addecuate to the new government priorities. GGGI is focusing in 2021 in: - Rural electrification (with support on preparation of the project documents for 10 minigrids to be financed by public budget) - Preparation of a methodology for scale-up rural electrification, including an assessmrnt in tariff options and development of tools for support project development (specifcally a master file with posibility to update prices and a simple design and calculation tool for solar PV off-grid projects) - the Office of the President has requested GGGI support on the solar PV project to be funded with GRIF funds (thorugh IDB). The support in 2021 will be to provide technicial inputs/comments into the project documents to be submitted to IDB for approval. The project cost is around 80 million USD and the site has been already selected by the Government.

mailing-address.narrative: Global Green Growth Institute, 19F Jeongdong Bldg., 21-15 Jeongdong-gil, Jung-gu Seoul 04523 Republic of Korea

title.narrative: Rural Electrification Programme proposal and supporting documentations developed and submitted for funding. Support GEA on developing a Rural electrification methodology and standarised toold and templates.
